page.title: 19HEALTH
page.content: No local doctor. Surgury is held in Village Hall every Monday 3pm served by 2 doctors from Glantwymyn clinic 4\ miles distant. About 3 patients attend each week & prescriptions are deliverd to the shop the following day. There are 2 district nurses & 1 home help servicing this area. A domiciliary chiropodist is available on request. Several villagers incapacitated & housebound. Some have retired here due to ill health. The main illness is Farmer's lung. Main cause of death is heart disease followed by cancer. Farm accidents are treated at Aberystwyth. Local spring water is often used for drinking in preference to chlorinated mains water. Some older Welsh villagers consider the villagers use too much water for washing. Some farms have their own water supply which can run dry in dry weather.
